intro: Reichardia integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are smooth and entire, with a basal rosette structure, and it produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. Reichardia integrifolia is adapted to harsh conditions and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
